candidates.title: feat(lib): update to `http` 1.0
candidates.body:
Updates dependencies `http` and `http-body` to 1.0.

To do so, implements `Clone` for `OnUpgrade`.

BREAKING CHANGE: Upgrade to `http` 1.0.

candidates.title: fix(examples): add backports feature requirement to tower_client example
candidates.body: tower_client example seems to require backports feature.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): disable unused futures-util alloc feature
candidates.body: `futures-util`'s `alloc` feature seems not to be used.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): use form_urlencoded crate directly
candidates.body: As `hyper`'s example uses `url` crate just for the re-exported `form_urlencoded`, seems to be able to use it directly.

candidates.title: Update http dep to 0.2.7
candidates.body:
This is required to use HeaderName::from_static in a const.

Without this, I was getting the following error:

```
RUSTFLAGS="--cfg hyper_unstable_ffi" cargo rustc --features client,http1,http2,ffi --crate-type cdylib
...
error[E0015]: cannot call non-const fn `http::header::HeaderName::from_static` in constants
  --> src/proto/h2/mod.rs:39:5
   |
39 |     HeaderName::from_static("keep-alive"),
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: calls in constants are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants

error[E0015]: cannot call non-const fn `http::header::HeaderName::from_static` in constants
  --> src/proto/h2/mod.rs:40:5
   |
40 |     HeaderName::from_static("proxy-connection"),
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: calls in constants are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants
```

I suspect part of the reason I was getting this error is that I had a development directory sitting around from months ago, meaning the Cargo.lock was pinning an older version of `http`.

https://github.com/hyperium/http/compare/v0.2.6..v0.2.7

candidates.title: Upgrade minimum tokio to 1.13
candidates.body: This is for `tokio::sync::watch::Sender::send_replace` as introduced in https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/commit/dee3236c97b5502290046b9d677e108089188a9e and fixes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3195

candidates.title: refactor(dependencies): move optional dependencies to optional section
chore(dependencies): move httparse to http1 feature
candidates.body: As `hyper::error::Parse` is a private type, `httparse` crate seems to be only used in http1 feature actually. Therefore `httparse` might be able to be moved to http1 feature.

candidates.title: chore(ci): check unused dependencies
candidates.body: Adds a CI job to check unused dependencies.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): reduce default dependencies
candidates.body: `httpdate` and `want` are used in some combinations of features. Although Cargo does not provide such a combined features configuration, the scopes could be reduced.

candidates.title: feat(upgrade): introduce tracing as an optional unstable feature
candidates.body:
This change allow users to opt out of tracing via the `tracing` crate by adding tracing as an optional feature. This change is part of the effort, outlined in #2874, to reach hyper 1.0.

Closes #3319
BREAKING CHANGES: tracing is disabled by default and requires users to opt in to revert to previous behavior.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): remove implicit features of optional dependencies
chore: Replace matches crate with std assert and matches macro
candidates.body: Replaces `matches` crate with std `assert` and `matches` macro.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): Allow socket2 0.5
candidates.body: Allows users to use `socket2` 0.5 version. When users want to use `tokio` which version is larger than 1.30, as it starts to use `socket2` 0.5, users depend on multiple versions of `socket2`, 0.4 and 0.5. According to the [changelog](https://github.com/rust-lang/socket2/blob/v0.5/CHANGELOG.md#050), as `hyper` 0.14 seems not to be affected by the `socket2`'s breaking changes, `hyper` might be able to allow users to use `socket2` 0.5.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): Remove unused num_cpus and tokio-util dependencies
candidates.body: These dependencies seem not to be used.

candidates.title: Add graceful_shutdown example.
candidates.body:
I wanted to have graceful shutdown after a timeout in my server application.  There is not an existing example that does exactly this.

This is mostly the existing `hello.rs` example with graceful shutdown added.

Thanks!

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): use futures-core via futures-util consistently
candidates.body: `hyper` has already used `futures-core` via `futures-util` at many places. We could reduce some costs to maintain dependencies by doing it consistently.

candidates.title: h2: add max_pending_accept_reset_streams configuration option
candidates.body: This allows users to set the configuration option from https://github.com/hyperium/h2/pull/668.

chosen_pr.title: Upgrade minimum tokio to 1.13
chosen_pr.body: This is for `tokio::sync::watch::Sender::send_replace` as introduced in https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/commit/dee3236c97b5502290046b9d677e108089188a9e and fixes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3195

chosen_detail.title: Upgrade minimum tokio to 1.13
chosen_detail.body: This is for `tokio::sync::watch::Sender::send_replace` as introduced in https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/commit/dee3236c97b5502290046b9d677e108089188a9e and fixes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3195
